text: Can you provide details on any limitations or restrictions regarding the number of files we can import into the file manager in HubSpot?
You don't need to post the same message in multiple channels.

Hi all, I'm trying (what I thought would be very simple) to format a multiple checkbox form question to display the list of options in three columns. Have tried via css but nothing is working. Has anyone found a solution to this?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hm, a random nitpick I just noticed — it’s basically impossible for a HubSpot site to have 100% valid markup because of an issue with the standard Rich Text module. The `hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text` wrapper uses a `<span>` element, which can’t contain flow content like `<h1>–<h6>` or `<p>`. _(or basically anything else that you can do with the rich text module)_

Since the `<span>` wrapper is contained within another, outer wrapper that uses a `<div>`, switching that inner wrapper to a `<div>` should correct the validation issue without an effect on layout or semantics.

Hi there, I was directed here by HubSpot Customer Support.  I'm trying to switch a single logo on a single landing page, and it isn't clear how I can do that.  Unfortunately two HS agents couldn't help and suggested I post my request here.  Thanks!

Hi there! Unfortunately, this is a little bit too vague to give actionable advice on. Could you provide some additional details about what exactly you’re trying to do, and how you’ve got things set up?

Sure! (and thanks for the response) I have a landing page where the logo at the top of the page says "Art of Procurement".  It is a global header.  What I'm trying to do is to update the logo just for this page (so have a header that isn't a global header just for that page, with a different logo. <https://resources.artofprocurement.com/art-of-supply-podcast-subscribe>.
I can share any other screenshots that may be helpful...

Ok, thank you so much <@U04AQA0QM8E>! I will try the CSS route as I'm not overly concerned about the stickiness, etc.  The theme was all custom coded by HubSpot to mirror our (then) website when we switched over to them.
Hello, guys! I wonder if HubSpot has any integrations with Azure Marketplace?
